forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 46. East wind around 15 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. Southeast wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

weather_report:
This morning in Evanston, the air feels brisk with a temperature settled in the low 50s and a gentle to breezy east wind making its presence known. The sky is partly cloudy, unveiling occasional glimpses of the nocturnal skyline above the calm waters of Lake Michigan. With the humidity hovering at a comfortable level, there's a refreshing quality to the cool air as we transition into the early hours of the day.

As the day unfolds, we're expecting partly sunny skies with a high nearing the upper 50s, albeit with temperatures gradually dipping in the afternoon. While there will be no significant precipitation to worry about, the gusty southeast winds—ranging up to 25 mph—will add a lively edge to the weather, perfect for those wanting to feel the natural elements. Given the current season, this weather is typical for mid-autumn in the Midwest and encourages attire suited for cool conditions. A light jacket or a cozy sweater will be ideal for anyone wishing to venture outdoors. This is an excellent day for a rejuvenating walk along the beach or a visit to the local parks, allowing you to soak in the crispness of the autumn air as the community prepares for the approaching holiday season.
